text: In the past, I've found the Imager Perl module to be hugely useful.
It has a better API than GD and ImageMagick (IMHO) and is very fast.
It also doesn't necessarily require external libraries such as libgd or ImageMagick except potentially the system library for reading/writing your desired file format.
I'm not going to try to answer the "which language is best" part of your question because I'm biased and that's the wrong question to ask anyway.
It should be "How can I do X with any of these languages" and then decide for yourself based on the language specific answers.
Judging from answers that pit one language against another is not advised.
Usually, the bias and agenda of the person providing the answer isn't clear and thus the value of the answer for deciding is nil.
You could look at what "phatch" does (http://photobatch.stani.be/), that's a python image batch pocessor.
It tries to use all the various open source image manipulation libraries (imagemagick, python's PIL, exiftools, etc) for the parts where they are good in.
So even if you (probably) end up not using phatch itself, you can get a good idea of which tools are good for what.
